result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. was found guilty of Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay costs directly to DOC.
Restitution to be paid directly to DOC.

Court orders no withholding of funds that are gifted. 
Court does not restrict what percentage of defendant's wages that is to be used to pay financial obligations. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. in court, in custody from WSPF.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Ct 1 and state will move to dismiss Ct 2. State recommends 3 yrs WSPS (2in and 1out) consecutive to previously imposed sentences with the following conditions to pay jail and DNA surcharge and to provide a DNA sample. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Ct 2 is dismissed on State's motion. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Michelson heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years WSPS (1in and 1 out), consecutive to previously imposed sentences, restitution, jail and DNA surcharge, and to provide a DNA sample. Defendant is not eligible for programming.

and transport
2 certified copies given to DA 8-9-22kb

Defendant Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. appeared by video, in custody from WSPF.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Dwayne Sweet Sr. Defendant can hear the court but the court can not hear the defendant. Attorney Mickelson has filed a waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court reviews the document with defendant and finds that the defendant freely and knowingly waives rights to a preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Attorney Mickelson requests a plea and sentencing date. Defendant would like to appear in person. Plea and sentencing date set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
